required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Total Neoadjuvant Therapy Versus Standard Therapy of Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer With High Risk Factors for Failure
clinical_study.official_title: Total Neoadjuvant Therapy Versus Standard Therapy of Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer With High Risk Factors for Failure

brief_summary.textblock: In a retrospective study, the investigators will compare patients with locally advanced rectal cancer with high risk factors for failure who were treated with standard therapy or with total neoadjuvant therapy.

primary_outcome.description: pathological complete response is defined as the absence of tumor cells in the surgical resection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during treatment, assessed up to 10 days
secondary_outcome.description: Neoadjuvant rectal cancer score: The NAR score was calculated using the equation [5 pN - 3(cT - pT) + 12]^2 / 9.61 and further classified as low (< 8), intermediate (8-16), or high (< 16).

other_outcome.measure: number of participants who completed treatment
other_outcome.time_frame: during treatment, assessed up to 10 days
other_outcome.description: Compliance - number of participants who completed treatment protocol

other_outcome.measure: number of participants with acute side effects
other_outcome.time_frame: during treatment, assessed up to 10 days
other_outcome.description: Acute toxcity - number of participants with side effects during different treatment modality

arm_group.description: Total neoadjuvant therapy consisted of 12 weeks of induction chemotherapy with CAPOX or FOLFOX, chemoradiotherapy with capecitabine and six to eight weeks of consolidation chemotherapy with CAPOX or FOLFOX prior to surgery.
Standard therapy (neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy, surgery, adjuvant chemotherapy)

study_pop.textblock: all adult patients with newly diagnosed LARC with high risk factors for failure who were treated with TNT or standard therapy at the Institute of Oncology, Ljubljana, from 2016 to 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically proven locally advanced rectal cancer and
- the presence of one of the factors: T4, N2, positive mesorectal fascia, presence of extramural vascular invasion or presence of lateral lymph node.
Exclusion Criteria:
- distant metastases,
- concomitant malignancy,
- inflammatory bowel disease, or
- malabsorption syndrome.
